DataElement.preferredName: Average Both Eye Schirmer Test Wetting With Anesthesia Procedure Result Millimeter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Result of calculation of the average tear measurement produced by both eyes using anesthesia.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Average Both Eye Schirmer Test Wetting
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The central tendency of a set of n numbers; lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered.:Two entities considered and identifed together.:The organ of sight or vision. Concepts.definition: A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
One and the other; relating to or being two in conjunction.
The organ of sight or vision.
A test used to determine the amount of tears collected on a filter paper strip in 5 minutes.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:(an-es-THEE-zha) Loss of feeling or awareness.  Local anesthetics cause loss of feeling in a part of the body.  general anesthetics put the person to sleep.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Treatment with a pharmacological substance that produces a loss of feeling.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
